intro: Coleosanthus veronicifolius petrophilus, commonly known as the rock fig, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It is a member of the Moraceae family, which includes figs and mulberries. The plant is characterized by its woody structure and produces small, greenish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. The rock fig is adapted to grow in rocky, nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
